oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Drawing of three Revolutionary soldiers
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: One of 28 artist's sketches of mural figures for Sevier State Office Building, Nashville. This drawing shows three Revolutionary soldiers with rifles.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Murals; Sketches; Soldiers
United States -- History -- Revolution, 1775-1783;
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Dean Cornwell
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Two murals depicting aspects of Tennessee history were installed in 1941. The artist, Dean Cornwell (1892-1960), painted them as part of the New Deal's Works Progress Administration (WPA) Federal Art Project. Cornwell also created murals for the Davidson County Courthouse, Los Angeles Public Library, and the Raleigh Room at the Hotel Warwick in New York City.
